questions.explanation:
Arsenic and Old Lace.

	Rebecca asked him why he didn't tell her. When he said he did, she said she was sick.

questions.text: Who did go to Woody's show?
questions.explanation:
Cliff and his mother.

	Cliff said his mom loved the idea of old ladies being cold-blooded killers. He said his mom loved the theatre.

questions.text: What did the review say about Woody?
questions.explanation:
Woody Boyd is weak.

	Woody was disappointed. Frasier told him, "There's no such thing as bad press as long as they spell your name right." Lilith replied, "Actually it says 'Woody Doyb is weak."

questions.text: What news did Madame LaZora have for Carla?
questions.correct: She was retiring at the end of the year.
options: She had lost her psychic powers.
questions.explanation:
She was retiring at the end of the year.

	Carla said Madame LaZora had been her spiritual adviser since she was 17.  Madame LaZora wanted Carla to take her job.

Madame LaZora's spiritual guide.

	Madame LaZora told Carla that Princess Katia was the one to have Carla take over. Carla said it was Madame LaZora's contact from the other side.

questions.text: Who was freaked out by Carla's supposed psychic abilities?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Woody asked him to explain it, and he couldn't. When he mentioned being freaked out when she knew the name of Sam's dog, Sam said he lied as to not hurt her feelings.

Lee Bradken.

	Lee Bradken was played by Jeffrey Richman. Besides acting, he is also a writer and a producer.

questions.text: Who had a mother with black hair and a Labrador retriever?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Sam told her she didn't really read his mind.  She said she must have read someone else's.  Then she realized the visions were from her own childhood.

Bob.

	Madam LaZora said Bob was her first client as well.  She also told Carla that she was nothing but a fraud.

questions.text: What song was Carla playing on the piano?
questions.explanation:
Greensleeves.

	Carla was very upset to learn that Madame LaZora was a fraud. Frasier asked her if she wanted to talk.  When she said no, he asked her if she wanted to be taught the correct fingering for "Greensleeves".
